subSections.title: Glyph origin
Etymology
subSections.text:
Various semantic fields can be distinguished:

; “to add; to accumulate”
: Related to {{och-l|壘|rampart; to build by piling rocks}}, {{och-l|厽}}, {{och-l|絫}} ({{zh-ref|Wang, 1982}}).

; “to damage; exhausted; tired”
: Related to {{och-l|儽|tired}}, {{och-l|儡|to injure}} ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}). It can be compared with {{cog|km|រួយ||tired; exhausted}}, {{cog|lus|rawih||weak; worn out; broken down}}, {{cog|bo|རུལ||to decay; to rot}}, {{m|bo|འབྲུལ||to fall; to come out}}, {{m|bo|ཧྲུལ་པོ||torn; ragged}}, {{m|bo|སྲུལ||(''archaic'') to rot; to decompose}} ([[ibid.]]).

; “to bind; to wind around”
: See {{och-l|纍}}.
